instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MACBOOK A1425  820-3462 A
threads.message:
Looking for some help here with this macbook , the owner stated that it was working ok then all of sudden it turned off and wouldnt power on again. What i got on the USB AMP METER IS 20V ---------- 0.27AMP
And 7.78 WATTS  

 I realise that the fan spins and U1800 gets super hot and no boot , I have not done anything yet , Please help me out to diagnose it .

threads.title: MACBOOK A1425  820-3462 A
threads.message:
If PCH gets super hot, it is probably damaged.
Check diode mode to ground readings on PCH and CPU coils.
Also check the other coils.

threads.title: MACBOOK A1425  820-3462 A
threads.message: I ran diode mode to ground and most of the lines are shorted I think PCH needs either reballing or replacement, the coils are also on low readings the other coils read well, I will try to reball the PCH to see if that does anything.

threads.title: MACBOOK A1425  820-3462 A
threads.message:
Do you think a massage to wood foot helps for something?
If PCH is shorted, throw it.

threads.title: MACBOOK A1425  820-3462 A
threads.message: Lol, Thank you for that Joke it made me laugh, Can it be changed if i  Harvest it from a donor board?

threads.title: MACBOOK A1425  820-3462 A
threads.message: You must get the same SRxxx code, marked on the chip...

threads.title: MACBOOK A1425  820-3462 A
threads.message: Yes thats the idea, I am trying to get one with thesame SRxxx code, Do you guys carry those ?

threads.title: MACBOOK A1425  820-3462 A
threads.message: You can buy it online, eBay, Aliexpress...
